etymology.description: phonetic: 予(予) (yǔ, 'give') + semantic: 頁(頁) (yè, 'page') -> association with preparation or planning ahead
etymology.interpretation: The character combines 予(予) (yǔ, 'give'), indicating the concept of granting or planning, with 頁(頁) (yè, 'page'), alluding to documentation or planning in advance. This represents the notion of forethought or preparation.
etymology.simplification: 預(預) to 预(預): 頁(頁) (yè, 'page') simplified to 页(页) to streamline the character while retaining phonetic and semantic components.

examples.chinese: 我们预习了考试内容(我們預習了考試內容)。
examples.english: I reviewed the exam content in advance.

examples.chinese: 他预先做了详细准备(他預先做了詳細準備)。
公司预定了下个月的展会场地(公司預定了下個月的展會場地)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngsī yùdìngle xià gè yuè de zhǎnhuì chǎngdì.
examples.english: The company booked the exhibition venue for next month in advance.
